title: Connection tree flickers & hourglass cursor when using with multiple users on one SQL database
author: olfolfolf
body_snippet:
We're using latest mRemoteNG stable 1.76.10 with and SQL database backend for sharing the connections.
In the database are about ~40 connections, mainly RDP.

Two users are using mRemoteNG, connected to the same sql db.
As soon as the 1st user opens a connection in mRemoteNG, the connection tree of the 2nd user flickers starts to flicker and a hourglass cursor appears.

Sometimes the problem is gone after a few seconds, sometimes we have to kill the process.
The problem is reproducable.
...

iterations.description: RemoteConnectionsSyncronizer polls SQL every 3s and does a full tree reload on any change, causing visible flicker and hourglass cursor in multi-user scenarios

notes:
AI triage (claude): RemoteConnectionsSyncronizer polls SQL every 3s and does a full tree reload on any change, causing visible flicker and hourglass cursor in multi-user scenarios
Approach: Wrap tree reload during sync with BeginUpdate/EndUpdate to prevent flicker, suppress WaitCursor during background sync polls, and consider merging changes into existing tree model instead of full rebuild
